channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CO

item.title: Report X-2024020520
item.description:
Report X-2024020520

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-15T12:17:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-23
  • City: DENVER
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE ARRIVED TO STATION LEAKING. PACKAGE DISCOVERED BY PACKAGE HANDLER DURING UNLOADING. UNLOAD MANAGER INFORMED. MANAGER INFORMS QA. DescribePack: LOOSE CAP ON JERRICAN DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: UNLOAD MANGER INFORM ABOUT SPILLAGE. QA INFORM ABOUT SPILLAGE, SDS SEARCHED ON INTERNET. PACKAGE BAGGED IN PLASTIC AND PUT INTO TOTE.GLOVES USED TO CLEAN UP SPILLAGE WITH PAPER TOWEL AND PUT INTO TOTE WITH ALL CONTAMINATED MATERIAL USE FOR CLEAN UP.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: A Fully regulated package game to QA wet and soiled after inspection loose cap on the bottle caused the spill soiling the box and other contents in the box DescribePack: loose cap on the bottle caused the spill DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: package was brought to QA in a lined tote for inspection

item.title: Report X-2024020265
item.description:
Report X-2024020265

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-15T12:17:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-10
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Pkg was in the unload when it was noticed wet, QA was notified, and QA placed in side a lined tote and took to hazmat cag. DescribePack: Closures came loose and liquid leaked out soiling outer carton and inner bottles DurationRel: 22 and MitigateEffect: Pkg. was placed inside a lined tote and was taken to hazmat cage.

item.title: Report X-2024020240
item.description:
Report X-2024020240

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-15T12:17:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-09
  • City: BROOMFIELD
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: During outbound, at 9:50pm, a load 2 manger found a leaking hazmat on the IC belt near door V141. The manager placed it in a plastic bag and bin and called QA. QA picked up hazmat and placed it in hazmat cage. DescribePack: There is a crack underneath the handle of the hazmat. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The hazmat was placed in a plastic bag and bin.

item.title: Report E-2024020076
item.description:
Report E-2024020076

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-12T18:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-30
  • City: DENVER
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On January 30, 2024, two (2) 55-gallon drums of UN1760 were leaking from the bungs and released approximately less than one (<1) cup of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Hazmat Services (EHS) to remediate the impacted site. Crews wiped down the released product with cleaners and absorbent pads. EHS personnel placed the damaged 55-gallon drum into one (1) 95-gallon poly overpack, and the one (1) undamaged 55-gallon drum and one (1) 95-gallon overpack were placed onto a pallet and gift wrapped for return to the terminal. Crews took one (1) poly liner of the absorbent pads and cleanup debris back to their shop.
